intro: Gratiola heterosepala, commonly known as the broad-leaved yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces a milky sap that is toxic, containing various alkaloids. Gratiola heterosepala is often found in savannas and along riverbanks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
